experience.title: Computer Vision
experience.description: Wilderness Satellite Image Classification | Professor Tomas Maul, University of Nottingham, Malaysiaâ€¢ Created Satellite Images dataset (17776 images) of forest & non-forest for Wilderness Classification using deep learningâ€¢ Implemented LeNet, VggNet (11,13,16 &19), ResNet9, Inceptionv1, MobileNetv2 and DenseNet121 model using Pytorchâ€¢ Developed DeepSatv2 (SOTA for satellite image classification) from scratch by adding 12 crafted features and got the maximum validation accuracy of 0.9888 and 0.0042 binary cross-entropy loss with DeepSatv2
experience.description_html: Wilderness Satellite Image Classification | Professor Tomas Maul, University of Nottingham, Malaysiaâ€¢ Created Satellite Images dataset (17776 images) of forest & non-forest for Wilderness Classification using deep learningâ€¢ Implemented LeNet, VggNet (11,13,16 &19), ResNet9, Inceptionv1, MobileNetv2 and DenseNet121 model using Pytorchâ€¢ Developed DeepSatv2 (SOTA for satellite image classification) from scratch by adding 12 crafted features and got the maximum validation accuracy of 0.9888 and 0.0042 binary cross-entropy loss with DeepSatv2

experience.title: Research Intern
experience.description: â€¢ Annotated the available 3000 OCT images for feeding into the UNet Semantic Image Segmentation modelâ€¢ Understood the development of UNet based Semantic Image Segmentation model for segmenting out the ELM lines from the annotated OCT images and Pytorch library was used for the development of the modelâ€¢ Achieved 98% Intersection of Union (IoU) on the test data by using Adam Optimizer for updating the weights upon each epoch
experience.description_html: â€¢ Annotated the available 3000 OCT images for feeding into the UNet Semantic Image Segmentation modelâ€¢ Understood the development of UNet based Semantic Image Segmentation model for segmenting out the ELM lines from the annotated OCT images and Pytorch library was used for the development of the modelâ€¢ Achieved 98% Intersection of Union (IoU) on the test data by using Adam Optimizer for updating the weights upon each epoch <!---->

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.description: â€¢ Investigating the effectiveness of presently available Covid-19 contact tracing apps on different parametersâ€¢ Started with a thorough search on the available apps, studied their privacy issues, and inspected their current public adoptionâ€¢ Preprocessed the dataset for implementation and comparison of Time Series (ARIMA model) and LSTM model based mobility prediction models to assess appsâ€™ effectiveness in face of realistic urban mobility scenarioâ€¢ Got lower RMSE (2913.13) for ARIMA based time series model than LSTM model (RMSE 4789.98)
experience.description_html: â€¢ Investigating the effectiveness of presently available Covid-19 contact tracing apps on different parametersâ€¢ Started with a thorough search on the available apps, studied their privacy issues, and inspected their current public adoptionâ€¢ Preprocessed the dataset for implementation and comparison of Time Series (ARIMA model) and LSTM model based mobility prediction models to assess appsâ€™ effectiveness in face of realistic urban mobility scenarioâ€¢ Got lower RMSE (2913.13) for ARIMA based time series model than LSTM model (RMSE 4789.98)

positions.subtitle: Spring Fest
positions.description: â€¢ Organized 61st Edition of Spring Fest, with a 26-member team which saw a participation of 10,000+participants.â€¢ Responsible for conducting the Eliminations at Raipur with another Core Team Member for the First Time for twoevents namely Poetry Slam and Hilarity Ensues which saw active participation.â€¢ Responsible for organizing Fashion Fest with a 300% YOY increase in Fashion Show and conducted Mr & Ms.Spring Fest for the First Time which saw active participation during the Spring Fest.â€¢ Coordinated sponsorship drive in Bangalore & Kolkata, raised â‚¹ 7.43 lakh through alumni contribution andcorporate deals and solely garnered funds of â‚¹ 5 lakhs from alumni contribution in Bangalore.â€¢ Co-led a team of 35 Associate Members, increasing overall in-house participation by 15% YoY and published 120+media articles, expanding the outreach of Fest to 650+ colleges.â€¢ I solely Spearheaded the Participant Reception Team in the fest that involved proper in-house accommodation andtransportation of 9000+ participants from over 450 colleges across the country.â€¢ Coordinated International Carnival, inviting artists from Iceland, Israel, Denmark, USA, Malta, Sweden & Canada.
positions.title: Core Organising Team Member
positions.description_html:
â€¢ Organized 61st Edition of Spring Fest, with a 26-member team which saw a participation of 10,000+participants.

corporate deals and solely garnered funds of â‚¹ 5 lakhs from alumni contribution in Bangalore.
â€¢ Co-led a team of 35 Associate Members, increasing overall in-house participation by 15% YoY and published 120+
media articles, expanding the outreach of Fest to 650+ colleges.

transportation of 9000+ participants from over 450 colleges across the country.
â€¢ Coordinated International Carnival, inviting artists from Iceland, Israel, Denmark, USA, Malta, Sweden & Canada.

positions.subtitle: Spring Fest
positions.description: â€¢ Been a part of 35 member team responsible for the publicity department of the fest for the 60th edition of the fest.â€¢ Responsible for the Publicity Drive of the Spring Fest in Chhattisgarh which saw a participation with 33% YOYincrease also responsible for Publicity in the Kolkata region.â€¢ Responsible for publishing 12 Newspaper Articles in the Chhattisgarh region which saw a 33% YOY increase.â€¢ I along with two more Associate Member as a part of the Participant Reception team during the fest, received morethan 5000+ participants from over 450 colleges and was responsible for there proper in-house transportation.â€¢ Responsible for the proper execution of the Food Fest genre during the fest that includes events and workshopbringing participation of more than 450 Food enthusiasts.
